newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico denies report of 463 pct government surplus.
newsitem.headline: Mexico denies report of 463 pct government surplus.

text.p: Mexico's Finance Ministry on Tuesday roundly denied a newspaper report that its first half government surplus had surged 463 percent to 29 billion pesos.
"The Finance Ministry categorically denies the validity of these figures," it said in a statement released late on Tuesday.
"The figures cited in the (Reforma newspaper) article do not correspond to the preliminary estimates for the Federal Government's financial statement," it added.
The statement said the Finance Ministry would release consolidated public sector financial results for the first half of the year on August 15.
"This office will publish...full and detailed information about the development of public finances on that date," it added. ((--Caroline Brothers, Mexico City newsroom +525 728 7905))
